post_text:
Fan information for Friday‚Äôs football game in Cavalier:
1- A purple ticket is needed for entry
2- Write your name and phone number on the back of the ticket. Tickets will be collected at the gate
3- Admission is $7 for adults, $5 for students and adults 55 and older
4- Please pay with exact change if possible
5- Face masks will be required for entrance and recommended while watching the game
6- Visitors can stand on the outside of the fence on the south side of the field using social distancing guidelines.

post_text:
Update as of 8.6.20-our School Board has approved a plan for fall sports. Please visit our website to see the plan in its entirety.

Please note that physicals are not being required by NDHSAA this year if you had one last year (except incoming 7th graders still need a regular physical). If you are not getting a physical since you had one last year you still have to fill out Form B along with the concussion form/handbook acknowledgement of risk (last 2 pages of Athletic Handbook) These 2 forms are required by the first day of practice-hand in to your coach or to the office (Both are available on our website). You may pay sports participation fees online through our website or you may mail/drop off a check at the school office. We will be collecting fees for FALL SPORTS ONLY at this time. JH Sports Participation Fee is $25.00/student per sport and HS is $30.00/student per sport with a family max of $100.00 per family.

https://www.mt-pleasant.k12.nd.us/apps/pages/index.jsp?uREC_ID=449422&type=d&termREC_ID=&pREC_ID=857520

post_text:
Rolla staff is working hard at getting all student belongings bagged and labeled. We have a great team working to get this completed for pickup on Monday March 30th. This will enable us to deep clean our lockers and classrooms, as well as make sure you have belongings you might be missing.

The weather looks amazing for Monday, SO, from 9-4 stop by the school parking lot to pick up student belongings. The bags will be organized by grade level in the elementary, alphabetically for 7-12 grade students. We'll have signs up to help you find your items. Please practice social distancing when making the pickup!

IF your student has library books out, there will be a drop off box available!

Goooooo Bulldogs!

post_text:
Tuesday afternoon update:
After a second day of planning and working as a staff, we would like to remind everyone that the doors of the school will be open tomorrow (Wednesday) from 8:00 AM until Noon. We strongly suggest that students stop in and grab their personal belongings as well as their textbooks. The plan as of now is to be able to come back to school on Monday, March 23, but that may change. Our teachers are all preparing lessons that will be able to be accessed online in the event that we are mandated to be closed past March 23. For those that signed up for lunch delivery, they will be delivered between 10:00-11:00.

post_text: Rolla Elementary Wrestling Tournament scheduled for tonight has been cancelled. Also, the Rolla Archery Tournament Scheduled for tomorrow has been cancelled.
text: Rolla Elementary Wrestling Tournament scheduled for tonight has been cancelled. Also, the Rolla Archery Tournament Scheduled for tomorrow has been cancelled.

post_text:
The Northern Lights Kids Wrestling Tournament for tonight will go on as scheduled. Parents use your own judgement.

Mt Pleasant Public Schools suggestion for those attending:
We encourage all attendees to take the following precautions before, after and during the event:
-Wash hands often with soap and water or use alcohol-based sanitizer.
-Cough and sneeze into the elbow or into a tissue. Throw away the tissue immediately after use and wash hands.
-Practice social distancing. Stay 6 feet or more away from people.
-Frequently clean and disinfect surfaces.

We encourage those in a high-risk group not to attend this event. People over 60, or those who are immune-compromised, and/or those with underlying chronic medical conditions are at a higher risk of having complications.

We recommend that attendees stay home if you are sick with cough, sneezing and or fever.

Please use these guidelines and common sense in making your decision to attend or not.

shared_text:
Pickle Palooza is at Rolla Public School.
September 10, 2019 at 7:05 AM ¬∑ Rolla, ND ¬∑

Deadline for pickleball tournament sign-up is Friday(9-13-19) at Noon. This is an indoor doubles tournament with the championship prize being these two Selkirk Amped paddles that retail for $129 each! Being held this Saturday, September 14, 2019 at the Rolla School at 2:00pm.

Please email us at rollaragtop@gmail.com with:

Your Name:
Partners Name:
Team Name:
Phone number:

There is a low $5 entry fee that will be taken at the door.

Hope to see you there!

post_text:
Storm Make Up Days: We have to make up 3 days so far this year.
Day 1: March 1st
Day 2: Will be adding 5 min to the beginning of day and 5 min to end of day starting MONDAY, March 3rd until the end of the year. (School will start at 8:30am and end at 3:20pm)
Day 3: Thursday, May 23rd

IF more days are needed, they will be used up as follows:
Monday, April 22nd will be Make up day 4 IF NEEDED.
Friday, May 24th will be Make up day 5 IF NEEDED.

Rolla Public School
February 24, 2019 at 3:53 PM ¬∑

After Prom Party Parent Meeting
Any parents (community members) that would like to help plan/organize Rolla's After Prom Party will be meeting on Wednesday, February 27th at 5:30pm in the New Commons at school.
Parents host the after prom party...all ideas and people are welcome in helping provide a safe and fun after prom night!! Prom will be held on March 30th.

post_text:
Due to the extreme temps there will be no rural buses running on Tuesday or Wednesday. The town bus will run as scheduled and school will start at the normal time on both Tuesday and Wednesday.

No Junior High practices on Tuesday or Wednesday. No Archery practice Tuesday. No wrestling dual Tuesday. No after school tutoring or 21st Century. Varsity practices will be over by 5:00 on both days.

The GBB game tonight against St John will take place as scheduled as will the BBB game on Thursday in St John.

post_text: Next Monday 10/29 is ‚ÄúDig Pink‚Äù night for the Bulldog VB team. We are playing Rolette/Wolford A, B, C, JH starting at 4:00. There will be carnival games from 3:30-6:00, a pumpkin decorating contest (bring your decorated pumpkin), bake sale and a cake walk following the VB match. Come out and support our VB girls as they raise money for this great cause and also in their quest for a win in our last regular season match of the season!!
